column6: Title: Add a new Careers page username_0: We'd like to add a new page to the website, at the address `www.gitpod.io/careers`, with a list of job opportunities and contact info for people who'd like to join us. ‚ù§Ô∏è Here is a mock-up of how the page could look like: (Note: The texts in this mock-up are mostly placeholders still. üòÖ We'll rephrase them into actual offers pretty soon.) username_0: FYI, here is the minified SVG for the Team Icon: ```svg ``` username_1: Here is the mockup with the moved text username_0: Thanks, and great texts! I would apply again. üôÇ username_1: Here is the text for the site: Gitpod: Gitpod is an online one-click IDE that launches ready-to-code dev environments from any GitHub page. Automating development environments eliminates hours of tedious setup time, improves teamwork, and makes software development more reproducible and scalable. We started developing Gitpod about 2 years ago and this April we officially launched it. Gitpod is a very young product which gives you lots of opportunities to shape its future. Currently we‚Äôre working in a team of less than 20 people and we‚Äôre planning to grow continually. Typefox: TypeFox is the company behind Gitpod with a team of developer tool specialists and longtime contributors to many open-source projects. We‚Äôre a driving force behind the language server protocol and initiators of Eclipse Theia, the next generation IDE that powers Gitpod. A characteristic of our team is a fervour to learn new things. We‚Äôre convinced that missing knowledge shouldn‚Äôt hold one back, but encourage us to learn more. Team: We‚Äôre a young and tech-driven team with the mission of creating developer tools for everyone. In our team we seek for an open and honest mindset, as well as an effective pragmatism. We lead, collaborate and contribute for open-source projects and would love to share that with you. We‚Äôre convinced that continuous learning and exploring is the way to go for sustainably building the best solutions. Therefore we‚Äôre always curious about new approaches. username_1: edited wording username_0: New Careers page is up-to-date. More work is happening in #165, so I'll close this issue.

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Pull requests taking forever
username_0: Why are some pull requests that been waiting for awhile for reviews aren't getting reviewed but yet some coming in NEW are getting them in less than an hour or a day?<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_1: I volunteer to administer this repo and get through PRs when I have the time and energy. Comments like this *don't* make me want to do this work.

If you need a PID urgently, then pay for one.

(I don't know why you are complaining. You've never opened a PR.)

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: FAQ - VSTS use a powershell script for building a .Net Standard Library
username_0: Since I had some issue with getting a powershell script working on VSTS with a Hosted VS2017 agent, I've written some FAQ text to address the issue if someone else struggle with that.

See converstion with @devlead in gitter: [Chat - See next 8 Messages](https://gitter.im/cake-build/cake?at=58d9ff8dad849bcf42272c94)

My PR for this issue: #326<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_0: Done with merge of #326

[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'brentvatne', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2017-12-07 21:10:16+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "This is a rough checklist:

- [x] hitSlop
- [ ] tab bar
  - tab selected tab to pop
  - if empty stack, scroll to top
- [x] touchable with ripple
- [ ] keyboard:
  - [x] autofocus and return key
  - [x] space under keyboard and dismissing
  - [x] keyboard type, capitalization and autocorrect
- [ ] animated with useNativeDriver
  - only some properties supported -- no layout properties. use
    transforms whenever you can rather than width/height/margin,
    so you can take advantage of this
- [ ] nativedriver for animated.event in scroll view or it'll be janky
- [ ] loading states
  - onPressIn trick for preloading
  - placeholder elements
  - using data that you already have to partially render
  - loading state for image: what do you see when it's not there? maybe
    grey placeholder, maybe gradient, maybe activity indicator, maybe
    low-res version
- [ ] deferring rendering expensive (eg: maps) when possible
- [ ] status bar color, size
- [ ] fading in network images
- [ ] cancellable gestures
- [ ] meaningful animations -- shared transitions for example
- [ ] respect battery state
- [ ] prompt before asking permissions
- [ ] portrait / landscape: lock if you don't support
- [ ] android back button: navigation library can do some things but not all
  for you, need to consider where else users expect it to work
- [ ] compress images properly, provide 2x/3x
- [ ] sometimes text should be selectable
- [ ] ellipsize truncated text
- [ ] respect network status
- [ ] splash screen (white flash)", 'title': 'Improving UX Guide (ongoing)', 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'calvinmikael', 'comment_id': 352294044.0, 'datetime': '2017-12-17 23:18:51+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': 'This is a great idea and I support you fully in your endeavors.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}

I've worked on a lot of the above in my react native apps, would love to help others save a bunch of time (and/or face).", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}

Hi Brent, I wanted to know if the repo was open to PRs with added content for the above list? If yes, what are the constraints within which the new content should be added (length, screenshots, links to resources, etc)?

As I've mentioned above, I'd love to contribute towards completing the above checklist. Look forward to your response!

Thanks", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}

cc @username_0', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}

column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Improving UX Guide (ongoing)
username_0: This is a rough checklist:

- [x] hitSlop
- [ ] tab bar
  - tab selected tab to pop
  - if empty stack, scroll to top
- [x] touchable with ripple
- [ ] keyboard:
  - [x] autofocus and return key
  - [x] space under keyboard and dismissing
  - [x] keyboard type, capitalization and autocorrect
- [ ] animated with useNativeDriver
  - only some properties supported -- no layout properties. use
    transforms whenever you can rather than width/height/margin,
    so you can take advantage of this
- [ ] nativedriver for animated.event in scroll view or it'll be janky
- [ ] loading states
  - onPressIn trick for preloading
  - placeholder elements
  - using data that you already have to partially render
  - loading state for image: what do you see when it's not there? maybe
    grey placeholder, maybe gradient, maybe activity indicator, maybe
    low-res version
- [ ] deferring rendering expensive (eg: maps) when possible
- [ ] status bar color, size
- [ ] fading in network images
- [ ] cancellable gestures
- [ ] meaningful animations -- shared transitions for example
- [ ] respect battery state
- [ ] prompt before asking permissions
- [ ] portrait / landscape: lock if you don't support
- [ ] android back button: navigation library can do some things but not all
  for you, need to consider where else users expect it to work
- [ ] compress images properly, provide 2x/3x
- [ ] sometimes text should be selectable
- [ ] ellipsize truncated text
- [ ] respect network status
- [ ] splash screen (white flash)
<issue_comment>username_1: This is a great idea and I support you fully in your endeavors.
<issue_comment>username_2: Any guidelines for anyone who wants to contribute towards completing the above checklist?

I've worked on a lot of the above in my react native apps, would love to help others save a bunch of time (and/or face).
<issue_comment>username_2: @brendanv 

Hi Brent, I wanted to know if the repo was open to PRs with added content for the above list? If yes, what are the constraints within which the new content should be added (length, screenshots, links to resources, etc)?

As I've mentioned above, I'd love to contribute towards completing the above checklist. Look forward to your response!

Thanks
<issue_comment>username_3: AFAIK there are no big constraints, but by looking at the current page ideally every point of the list should have a GIF showing the improvement & a link to an Expo Snack that shows the code to improve the UX.

cc @username_0
<issue_comment>username_4: To be honest I think we set the bar for this document a little too high, I
myself stopped contributing because I simply didn‚Äôt have enough time to
craft gif+snack for every example.<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_3: maybe worth closing this since it's been open for over 2 years. We should probably instead open small issues per each actionable.

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: bradl3yC - 2429 - Add tabIndex to requested nodes
username_0: ## Description
Add tabIndexs to specific nodes to allow them to be access via keyboard/tab

## Testing done


## Screenshots


## Acceptance criteria
- [ ]

## Definition of done
- [ ] Events are logged appropriately
- [ ] Documentation has been updated, if applicable
- [ ] A link has been provided to the originating GitHub issue (or connected to it via ZenHub)
- [ ] No sensitive information (i.e. PII/credentials/internal URLs/etc.) is captured in logging, hardcoded, or specs
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0 && @kelsonic Great point about hard coding tab indexes a number of times. I think it's the right call to create platform functions, and work through updating these at once, so we can properly attach QA time and energy since we're broadening scope. I'll add a platform ticket now, and update my comment.

Will also change my change request to approved and point to this comment.
<issue_comment>username_0: @department-of-veterans-affairs/frontend-review-group ready for review üëç
<issue_comment>username_1: Added a related sitewide issue https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/issues/5125

column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Issue with k8s.io/zh/docs/tasks/tools/install-kubectl-windows/
username_0: kubectl completion powershell
error: Unsupported shell type "powershell".
See 'kubectl completion -h' for help and examples
<issue_comment>username_1: EN page: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/tools/install-kubectl-windows/

It seems that you can use `kubectl completion powershell` with `kubectl` v1.23~.

If you are using `kubectl` ~v1.22, then you cannot use `kubectl completion powershell`.

Please run `kubectl version`, and copy & paste the result to here!

For example:

```
‚ùØ kubectl version                                            
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"21", GitVersion:"v1.21.9", GitCommit:"b631974d68ac5045e076c86a5c66fba6f128dc72", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2022-01-21T02:19:59Z", GoVersion:"go1.16.13", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

/kind support
/retitle Issue with 'kubectl completion powershell'
<issue_comment>username_0: Thank you! 
My version is 1.22, I will update to 1.23
<issue_comment>username_1: It seems that this issue has been resolved and okay to close. üòä
/close

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: "Error 503 Success" on install pages
username_0: I can't load any of these pages:

https://www.dartlang.org/install
https://www.dartlang.org/install/archive

They give:

```
Error 503 Success
Success

Guru Mediation:
Details: cache-lhr6348-LHR 1519812846 2337442931

Varnish cache server
```
<issue_comment>username_0: Ugh, what... works fine in Edge, but bad in Chrome (including in Incognito with no extensions/cookies etc.)
<issue_comment>username_0: Left is normal Chrome, failing... right is Incognito working.

![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1078012/36783530-39e0f7a0-1c74-11e8-8898-76f695ce7736.png)
<issue_comment>username_0: In dev tools on the "Clear Storage" tab I have everything ticked and clicked "Clear site data", yet still it fails to load on a force-refresh. Still works in Incognito. I'm baffled. Here's a new screenshot showing normal/incognito with the (request) headers all looking the same to me?

![broken](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1078012/36783803-24076706-1c75-11e8-95ae-aa420c247c84.png)
<issue_comment>username_0: Actually, I had it broken in Incognito mode just now, so I think it's flaky (though hitting refresh a bunch doesn't make it look that way!)
<issue_comment>username_1: Hi Danny, thanks for the detailed feedback. I've also noticed some flakiness with Incognito, but in this case maybe you are hitting #584. Would you mind trying one of the solutions proposed there and letting me know if that helps?

cc @username_2
<issue_comment>username_0: Adding a query string doesn't help :(

I have two windows open side-by-side - one in incognito and one normal, one is broken, one is fine - hitting refresh endlessly in each one produces the same content (always the error in one, never in the other). If I restart my browser, there's a chance it works and if it does, it's always good, but if it doesn't, it's always bad.

It feels a little like there's a broken server and sticky load balancing means once you hit it you're stuck with it until you get a new session. However, there are no cookies in my requests in Incognito so if that's what's happening, I'm not sure what the stickiness would be based on (I also don't know whether there is any such load balancing/stickiness, I'm just thinking out loud).
<issue_comment>username_1: Does `curl -X PURGE ...` have any effect?
<issue_comment>username_0: I'm on Windows and apparently PowerShell's equiv of `curl` doesn't like custom methods:

```text
M:\Coding\Applications\Dart-Code [master ‚â°]> Invoke-WebRequest -Method 'PURGE' https://www.dartlang.org/install/archive
Invoke-WebRequest : Cannot bind parameter 'Method'. Cannot convert value "PURGE" to type "Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.WebRequestMethod". Error: "Unable to
match the identifier name PURGE to a valid enumerator name. Specify one of the following enumerator names and try again:
Default, Get, Head, Post, Put, Delete, Trace, Options, Merge, Patch"
```

However... since the error seems to be sticky within a session, I'm not sure if it'd make a reliable test (since I don't know if it'd hit the same node that's serving up the errors?).

I re-read some of the related issues on that other one, and it seems they were serving 404s (not found), but these are 503s (service unavailable?) so could be unrelated.

Aaaand, ofcourse I am now unable to reproduce the issue entirely :(
<issue_comment>username_2: Scary. I'll add this to the internal bug.
<issue_comment>username_2: @username_0 are you in NW England right now? (It matters if it's a CDN issue.)

@username_1 let's avoid updating the site, if possible, for a few hours.
<issue_comment>username_1: Np, I'm working on webdev atm.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_2 I am indeed in NW England :)<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_2: I'm going to close this since it looks like it was due to a known outage: https://status.firebase.google.com/incident/Hosting/18003
